transportAdvice: Rovinj's compact old town is best explored on foot, as the historic peninsula is largely car-free and very walkable. Local buses connect the town to nearby areas, and taxis are generally available for longer journeys or transfers to and from the airport.

weather.description: Cool and quiet winter month with occasional rain and few tourists, making it peaceful but limited in beach activities.
Still cool with occasional rain showers, though days can be crisp and pleasant for sightseeing without crowds.
Spring begins to emerge with milder temperatures and longer days, though rain remains a regular possibility.
Pleasantly warm and increasingly sunny, ideal for exploring the old town and coastal paths before peak season crowds arrive.
Warm and largely sunny with comfortable temperatures, making it one of the best months to visit for sightseeing and early swimming.
Hot and sunny with long days and calm seas, marking the start of the busy summer tourist season.
Peak summer heat with abundant sunshine and very warm sea temperatures, though the town is at its most crowded.
Equally hot and sunny as July with the highest tourist numbers, perfect for beach and water activities.
Warm and still very pleasant with the sea retaining summer warmth, and crowds beginning to thin noticeably.
Mild autumn temperatures with increasing rainfall, but still enjoyable for walking and dining outdoors in the quieter atmosphere.
Noticeably cooler and wetter with most tourist facilities winding down, suited to those seeking a tranquil off-season visit.
Cold and quiet with a festive atmosphere in town, though rain and chilly winds are common throughout the month.
